fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, it is not possible to query events for a specific time span of the day, from a period of time.
For example: Show me the issues created in the last 6 months that were created between 17h00 and 08h00.
This won't be possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a JQL query for a specific time span of the day, from a period of time.

h3. Why this is important
It is relevant to managers/admins to understand which time of day is the most intense of issue creation, for example.

h3. Workaround 
If needed, the admin can export the issues to a csv file and use the spread sheet editor (Office, OpenOffice, Numbers, etc) to perform the query.

 !JQL yay.png|thumbnail! 

 !JQL nay.png|thumbnail! 

 !Export to CSV.png|thumbnail! 

 !CSV exported.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow a JQL query for a specific time span of the day, from a period of time

fields.description:
When I am on an epic in JIRA, I want to be able to easily access the report and burndown for that epic, so that I don't have to navigate to reports, then epic report, then try to find my epic from the list there.

This could be accomplished in many ways, but suggest that a link to the report page, or a tab that pulls in the report would be relatively simple.  Else there could be a summary view of the information (e.g. number of sprints to complete) that then links to the full report.

Do the same thing for release pages!
fields.summary: Create a direct link from an Epic to its corresponding Epic burndown and Epic report

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira's Look and Feel menu, we have the option to select the Background and Text colours for buttons in Jira, however, we don't have the option to change the Highlight background and Highlight Text colours, lie we have for the 'Menu Item' and 'Header' sections.
h3. Desired new options:
 * Button Highlight Background Colour
 * Button Highlight Text Colour

h3. Similar existing options:
 * Menu Item Highlight Background Colour
 * Menu Item Highlight Text Colour
 * Header Highlight Background Colour
 * Header Text Highlight Colour
fields.summary: Include 'Button Highlight Background Color' & 'Button Highlight Text Color' to Look and Feel Colour Picker
Two Dimensional Gadget shows filter with special characters eventhough the filter is using the custom field ID for searching when clicking on the results.

fields.description:
In JIRA it's easily possible to lose work (certainly in Chrome) by letting the tab or chrome close.

when creating a new JIRA or editing, JIRA should block chrome from closing a tab without any warning at all.
you can easily lose work with a wrong click or keyboard shortcut.

Currrently JIRA only warns if you hit the cancel button in the app itself
fields.summary: JIRA should warn before letting a tab close

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

ATST has *Plan your upgrade* feature to recommend upgrade version based on customer current version and license. For DC license, it should recommend latest ER version. Otherwise recommends the latest stable version

The problem is the plugin is not aware of latest Jira 8.5 ER version and still recommending the previous  7.13.9 ER below

!eererererer.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Install Jira DC 7.6.9
* navigate to *Plan your upgrade* page

h3. Expected Results
* Recommending Jira 8.5 ER

h3. Actual Results
* Recommending Jira 7.13.9 ER

h3. Workaround

Ignore the recommendation and upggrade to 8.5 ER
fields.summary: Plan your upgrade in ATST plguin does not recognize Jira 8.5 ER

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

SSL configuration for Jira is unnecessarily cumbersome and fiddly. We can resolve part of that by including the Configuration Utility and keytool functionality within the Jira UI. 

h3. Suggested Solution

HTTPS configuration should be part of the Admin section in JIRA itself, not in a separate utility.  

h3. Why this is important

The UI-based instructions in [Running Jira applications over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-938847764.html] require a sysadmin to download a third party utility (Portecle) and then attempt to modify the {{server.xml}} using the Jira Configuration Utility. For this reason, many admins prefer to simply use keytool and modify the {{server.xml}} manually, but this can still be a somewhat taxing and error-prone process. 

Including the necessary libraries and select functionality within the Admin section of Jira would reduce the burden on admins.
fields.summary: Include SSL configuration within Jira Admin section

fields.description: As an administrator, I would like to have a parameter for this endpoint to only return audit records for a specific project.
fields.summary: Ability to filter audit reports by using api/2//auditing/record/ REST

fields.description:
h3. Definition
At the moment, you can only define Application Access when you invite users in Jira which is not efficient in a way that for some Projects, the Browse Project permission is restricted to some groups, therefore, the users won't be able to view the projects assigned to them.

h3. Suggestion
Have the possibility to define group membership when inviting Jira users.
fields.summary: Define group membership for the Invited Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If clicking on the 'Create' button, it will prompt the 'Create' issue pop-up:
 !JiraCreate.png|thumbnail! 
In this screen, the Project and Issue Type field are in the same screen.

However, accessing the 'Create' button via new tab or window, it will access the CreateIssue!default.jspa URL which result in this:
 !JiraCreate2.png|thumbnail! 
In this screen, the Project and Issue Type field are in a separate screen than the other fields. This would require to click the button in order to access the other screen, resulting in a 2 steps process.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a configuration to display the CreateIssue!default.jspa URL in a similar layout as the 'Create Issue' pop-up

h3. Workaround 
In the new tab or window, click the 'Create' button or press the 'C' key to prompt the shortcut.
fields.summary: Allow to have a similar layout as the 'Create Issue' pop-up when accessing the 'Create' button via new tab or window

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Existing mentions are shown with AccountID after backup is imported into Jira Server from Cloud. 

h3. Environment

Jira 8.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Mention a user in Jira Cloud, you should see their name on the mention once you save the comment. 
# Generate a backup for Server and restore this to a Server instance
# Check the same issue you mentioned previously in Cloud

h3. Expected Results
The Users name still present on the issue

h3. Actual Results
The AccountID is shown instead: 
 !mention.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes
* Related to changes made in Cloud due to GDPR: 
** [Say goodbye to usernames in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud]
** [Changes to usernames in Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/gdpr-changes-to-usernames-in-jira-cloud-967319102.html]
* We see from the database that the AID is mapped to the username in the external_id column in Jira Server.

h3. Workaround
This should give you a list of update queries to run, we recommend testing this in a lower enviornment and as always backing up the DB before running anything :) 

*PostgreSQL:*
{code:sql}
SELECT ('UPDATE jiraaction SET actionbody = replace(actionbody, ''accountid:' || cu.external_id || ''', ''' || cu.lower_user_name || ''') WHERE actionbody LIKE ''%[~accountid:' || cu.external_id || ']%'';') as "Queries to fix" FROM cwd_user cu WHERE cu.external_id IS NOT NULL; {code}

*MySQL:*
{code:sql}SELECT (CONCAT('UPDATE jiraaction SET actionbody = replace(actionbody, ''accountid:' , ifnull(cu.external_id, '') , ''', ''' , ifnull(cu.lower_user_name, '') , ''') WHERE actionbody LIKE ''%[~accountid:' , ifnull(cu.external_id, '') , ']%'';')) as "Queries to fix" FROM cwd_user cu WHERE cu.external_id IS NOT NULL; {code}
fields.summary: Cloud to Server Import will show existing mentions with AccountID rather than name

fields.description:
{panel:title=Solution|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This problem is caused by a bug in the Java runtime: _JDK-8214418 HttpClient falls in running with 100% cpu usage after an error signalled on channel_ (Backported as [JDK-8241054|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8241054])

The fix has been verified to be available in AdoptOpenJDK 11.0.8 - [https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk11u/commit/8d1b63a4db2c6348a97b3cf45bd4d2caa7cad6b5]
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira is running against Java 11, TLS 1.3 requests can cause httpclient threads to become blocked
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This is possible with any app that uses TLS 1.3 in an environment running Java 11.x. We were able to reproduce this using the Jira Mobile app Android client.
 # Have Jira Mobile app plugins enabled
 # Have Jira Mobile Android users register/sign in via the mobile app

h3. Expected Results

Users can sign in and use Jira. Everything functions normally. 
h3. Actual Results

All http threads eventually become blocked on one I/O Dispatcher thread. The instance stops accepting incoming connections. After a restart, the instance stays online/available for some period of time before all connections are consumed again.
h3. Symptoms

Top output on the Jira process shows one CPU core running hot on an I/O dispatcher thread. Other cores are silent/idle.
{code:java}
top - 14:42:22 up 1 day, 18:37,  2 users,  load average: 0.99, 1.00, 1.02
Tasks: 417 total,   1 running, 416 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
Cpu(s): 20.4%us,  0.2%sy,  0.0%ni, 79.2%id,  0.2%wa,  0.0%hi,  0.0%si,  0.0%st
Mem:  49409424k total, 49029788k used,   379636k free,   628400k buffers
Swap:  4194300k total,        0k used,  4194300k free, 35948404k cached

   PID USER      PR  NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND                                                
 44673 jira      20   0 22.3g  10g 839m R 98.4 21.5 395:41.77 I/O dispatcher                                         
 44475 jira      20   0 22.3g  10g 839m S  0.0 21.5   0:00.00 java                                                   
 44476 jira      20   0 22.3g  10g 839m S  0.0 21.5   0:00.84 java                                                   
 44477 jira      20   0 22.3g  10g 839m S  0.0 21.5   1:38.88 ParGC Thread#0                                         
 44478 jira      20   0 22.3g  10g 839m S  0.0 21.5   5:00.21 VM Thread   
{code}
Analysis of thread dumps shows over 150 threads are blocked on an I/O Dispatcher:
{code:java}
"I/O dispatcher 11" #178 daemon prio=5 cpu=23801052.84ms elapsed=25002.07s tid=0x00007f2d788b2800 nid=0xae81 runnable  [0x00007f2cb5320000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.writeRecord(java.base@11.0.4/SSLEngineImpl.java:185)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.wrap(java.base@11.0.4/SSLEngineImpl.java:136)
	- eliminated <0x000000052cca4538> (a sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.wrap(java.base@11.0.4/SSLEngineImpl.java:116)
	- locked <0x000000052cca4538> (a sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl)
	at javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine.wrap(java.base@11.0.4/SSLEngine.java:479)
	at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.doWrap(SSLIOSession.java:263)
	at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.doHandshake(SSLIOSession.java:301)
	at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.isAppInputReady(SSLIOSession.java:503)
	- locked <0x000000052cca44f8> (a org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIODispatch.inputReady(AbstractIODispatch.java:120)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.BaseIOReactor.readable(BaseIOReactor.java:162)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.processEvent(AbstractIOReactor.java:337)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.processEvents(AbstractIOReactor.java:315)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.execute(AbstractIOReactor.java:276)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.BaseIOReactor.execute(BaseIOReactor.java:104)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor$Worker.run(AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor.java:588)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(java.base@11.0.4/Thread.java:834)
{code}
Further analysis of the {{http-nio-xxxx-exec-xx}} threads may help identify the exact app, plugin, or package(s) stimulating the problem. In this example, we saw a large number of http threads pointing to the Jira Mobile app.
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-50 url:/rest/nativemob...ation/registration username:xxxxxxx" #2646 daemon prio=5 cpu=102935.39ms elapsed=19829.30s tid=0x00007f2ccc2d5000 nid=0xbd24 waiting on condition  [0x00007f2c1d9b1000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe.park(java.base@11.0.4/Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000509872550> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
{code}
Heap dump analysis may be required.
h3. Solution

Upgrade AdoptOpenJDK to version 11.0.8 which has this issue solved.

 
h3. Workaround

Disable TLS 1.3 on the JVM running Jira
 # Stop Jira
 # Add the following option to Jira's [startup options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]:
{code:java}
-Djdk.tls.client.protocols=TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2
{code}

 # Start Jira

Alternate workarounds:
 - Disable the app, plugin, or module found to be the cause of the stuck I/O Dispatcher thread
 - Install Java 8 and point Jira to that JRE/JDK instead of Java 11
fields.summary: When Jira is running against Java 11, TLS 1.3 requests can cause httpclient threads to become blocked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you create a Jira task with the summary "test <> test", and then have Slack alert on it, it generates a notification with a correct, but un-pretty URL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Slack integration to notify on issue creation for a project
 # Create a new issue using the summary "test <blah> test"

h3. Expected Results
Slack notification should read:
$user has created a Task ISSUE-1: test <blah> test

h3. Actual Results
Slack notification reads:
$user has created a Task <$BASE_URL/browse/ISSUE-1/atLinkOrigin=XXXX...XXXXISSUE-1: test <blah> test

h3. Workaround
Refrain from using the following characters in an issue Title '<' '>'
fields.summary: Adding special character to title of newly created ticket mangles Slack notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira configuration tool will incorrectly edit the server.xml
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download Jira 8.4.2 zip
 # Extract
 # Create home dir
 # Edit line 72 of server.xml to add proxy params to it
 # Run config.sh and configure the home dir and the DB
 # Save the config

h3. Expected Results

Server.xml is unmodified
h3. Actual Results

The {{server.xml}} has been updated and the connector now enables SSL, and added keystore params. Also, we get an error when saving the config warning about the missing Keystore Path as shown in the screenshot below.
 (!) If we do the same through the console, we get no warnings/errors and the server.xml file is overwritten as reported, adding the keystore parameters

!sup_tool.png|width=567,height=467!
h3. Workaround

If we do the same through the console, we get no warnings/errors and the server.xml file is overwritten as reported, adding the keystore parameters
fields.summary: The Jira configuration tool will incorrectly edit the server.xml

fields.description:
Hi,

I know there is already some suggestions about the system filters and hiding. Mainly the reason is that when you do not use resolution then you get the error for example for "Open Issues". I think this is a bug and should be fixed.

But my suggestion is about the system filters itself. And I would like not only hide them but also edit or set or change its jql definition. So the administrator can customize them.

The main reason is the user experiance with Jira so the user do not see any messed filters that are not relevant even that make some error!

If the user open Filters then there is a list of system filters that are not relevant for custom projects. 
 Pretend for example filter "Done issues". It has this jql definition: 
 "statusCategory = Done order by updated DESC"

and for our project this is irrelevant because our issues that are "Done" are not ony that with "statusCategory = Done" but also that with custom field "MyTypeClose" set to "Fine".

So our jql definition should look like: "
 statusCategory = Done and MyTypeClose = Fine order by updated DESC

If there will be possible to edit the definition of system filters then then a lot of users can do anything with filters and they can fix its error with resolution and also others can set their own filter for all system filters. This would be very nice because then the Jira will again be more customizable and nice :).

So my solution and suggestion is:
 1) please make editable the system filter defintion
 - either on the whole jira
 - or on the project level

2) please make possible to hide the system filters
 - as in here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63317

 

Please others see this suggestion and if you would like to have it vote for it. 

 

Best Regards
fields.summary: Edit, set, change jql definition or hide the system filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recently Created gadget language does not follow the language chosen by the user in their user profile. It will also not follow the system language, it will only follow the language that is used during the initial setup of Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira.
 # Use 'Nederland' as a default language.
 # Log in as a user with 'English' as their language.
 # Create a Recently Created gadget on the dashboard. 

h3. Expected Results

The gadget language will follow the system language/user profile language.
h3. Actual Results

The gadget language will follow the first language used when installing Jira.
h3. Workaround

If you want the gadget language to follow the system default, you can follow the steps provided [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-locale-for-jira-server-314450433.html].
fields.summary: Recently Created gadget language does not follow the language chosen by the user in their user profile.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Images added inline to either a description or a comment in Jira can be configured (in the text editor) to use specific image attributes such as height, width, valign, etc.  While these can use specific number of pixels, they can also be setup to use a percentage of the space, such as width="100%".   When you set this up in the text editor, it works just fine.  However any subsequent edits of that description/comment from any user using the visual editor will inadvertently drop the % character entirely from that img tag, leaving the image sized in pixels rather than percentage of the field on the screen.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Comment to an existing issue and include an image citation with a width=100% attribute, such as:
{noformat}
!scales.png|width=100%! {noformat}
(this could also be done in the Description field as well)

 # Click Save and notice that the image shows full width of that comment/description field.
 # Click the pencil to edit the comment. Make sure you are in the Visual edit mode.
 # Make any type of change (but don't modify the image).
 # Click Save and notice that the image is no longer scaled to the full size of the field.
 # Click the pencil again and go back to Text editor mode
 # Notice that Jira removed the "%" character after the "100". You can reinsert the "%" to fix things, but the problem will recur every time you edit the comment using the Visual tab.

h3. Expected Results

The image should remain unchanged and still appear as scaled to the full width of that field (100%)
{noformat}
!scales.png|width=100%! {noformat}
!scales.png! 
  
h3. Actual Results

The image now is exactly 100 pixels wide instead of 100% the width of that field in the users browser.
{noformat}
!scales.png|width=100! {noformat}
!scales.png|width=100!
h3. Notes:
 * Does not appear to affect the Text editor at all, only the visual editor
 * Credit to [~dave898462241] for reporting this bug in https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/quot-width-100-quot-on-image-tags-gets-broken-on-subsequent/qaq-p/1211588

h3. Workaround

None currently exist. Should a work-around be found, this will be updated to reflect this change.
fields.summary: Using the Visual editor does not honor img tag attributes that use percentage characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there is a @mention in a comment in *Visual mode*, pasting text from the clipboard will insert it after the @mention and not in the right place (right after the cursor).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open comment section in the ticket and click the *visual* mode.
 # Add some mention.
 # Write text.
 # Use paste (CTRL+V) to insert text at cursors position.

(Attaching a video to reproduce)

[^Jira-8.2.5-comment-paste-issue.mov]
h3. Expected Results

Text gets inserted at the cursor's position at the end.
h3. Actual Results

Text gets inserted after the mention, before the already written text with the cursor at the end. (see attached video)
h3. Workaround
 * Use text mode.
 * Before pasting the text (CTRL+V), click to set the cursor manually at the end. In this way, you make sure the text will be inserted in the right place.

h3. Note
This is not reproducible in 8.5
fields.summary: Pasting text in comment on Visual mode doesn't work properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a custom field contains a special character, when searching for a custom field using Advanced Searching will result in the error "Field: 'xxx' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it"

This issue is due to JRASERVER-66244, however, I do think that the error thrown is misleading and should be replaced with an error 'Special characters cannot be included in JQL searches'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with a special character in it. For example, 'Client[s]'.
 # Head to the Issue Navigator. Click on *Advanced Searching*.
 # Create a JQL filter as follows.
{code:java}
project = 'test' AND client[s] = Atlassian.{code}

 # This error will be shown.
 !image-2019-10-28-17-00-55-413.png|width=1174,height=90!

h3. Improvement

Instead of showing the error "Field: 'xxx' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it", you should instead change it to "Special characters cannot be included in JQL searches. Search cannot be executed. Please remove the special characters from your search query"
h3. Workaround

Search using the custom field ID instead.
fields.summary: If a custom field contains a special character, when searching for a custom field using will result in the error "Field xx does not exist or you do not have permission to view it". This can be misleading as special characters cannot be searched anyways.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On gadget view if we have 1 ticket for "a" label and click on it, JIRA navigates us to filter that contains 4 tickets (all tickets in filter), not 1. As well, as we have 3 tickets for "A", we will be navigated to the same filter with 4 tickets. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 issues and put the Label as "A"
# Create 1 issue and put the Label as "a"
# Create a Gadget to display the issues with the Label "A" & "a"
 !Gadget View.PNG|thumbnail! 
# Click on any Label, we would expect to see the issues that match the number. However, will be shown the total instead
 !Filter Results 1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Filter Results 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Seeing the issues that match with the number was shown in the Gadget

h3. Actual Results
Get the total issues of the Labels instead

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Clicking the label in chart gives different number of issues in filter than what the gadget shows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Intermittently, the More > Attach files option doesn't upload the selected file.

Issue can be reproduced with JIRA 8.2.4 and JIRA 8.3.3.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access JIRA application via Chrome internet browser
 # Browse to an issue
 # Attach a file via More > Attach files option

h3. Expected Results

File should be uploaded.
h3. Actual Results

File is not uploaded, intermittently.

*Investigation Done*
 * No issue drag-and-drop or upload the file via 'browse' option in the attachment panel
 * Problem is not isolated to specific file type or file size
 * Issue is reproducible with Chrome 76.0.3809.100 and 77.0.3865.90 (regular and incognito windows)
 * No error or log message indicative of problem with the file upload
 * Attached is the HAR file capturing the 2 failed attempts, follow by a successful file upload – [^fileattach.har]
 * Reviewing the HAR file, I noticed that the main difference between the failing and successful requests is the Blob URL. The successful request created a Blob URL and proceed with the file upload, but the failing request doesn't: 
 !blob.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Drag and drop/ browse and select the file at the Attachments panel.
fields.summary: File upload via More > Attach files not working intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira can display the wrong GMT information if the User Time Zone is under Daylight Savings.

h3. Issue Impact
There's no impact aside from wrong information being displayed to users on their Profile. Pages and blogs are saved with the right time information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Jira as any user.
# Click on the Profile Picture in the right upper corner.
# Click on Profile.
# Click on the Settings Tab.
# Observe that Eastern Time is displayed as GMT-0500 even though from March to November it is supposed to be GMT-0400 due to DST - This is one example, other timezones may be affected as well:

h3. Expected Results
Jira should be considering the DST offset to display the right GMT on that screen when the user timezone is affected by DST.

h3. Why this happens
Jira is leveraging the [Java Time Zone getRawOffeset|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/TimeZone.html#getRawOffset()] method. It does return GMT-0500 as EST Timezone. It then parse it to display the information to users on screen
fields.summary: Jira displays wrong GMT on User Profile when under Daylight Savings

fields.description:
When creating an issue, Jira says the issue was successfully created, but if the Mail Server blocks the issue created notification because of something like the attachment size, Jira doesn't rollback the issue creation.

It would be nice if Jira doesn't confirm that the request is received until it's actually received.
fields.summary: Rollback issue creation if the Issue Created notification fails to be sent/delivered

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, Jira passes the X-AUSERNAME header to identify when a request is sent from a valid user account or an anonymous user. Under certain circumstances, this may be undesired to expose the user name on the request.

h3. Suggestion
Add a configuration option to allow this header to be hidden from the requests.
fields.summary: Allow Jira administrators to hide the X-AUSERNAME header

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When a Jira Core Mail handler (configured in ⚙ > System > Incoming Mail) is setup with a Service Desk Project and with the "Create users" option enabled, the creation of new users from email will fail if no default application access it set in the Jira instance.

The following error will be thrown in the Jira Incoming Mail Logs:
{code}
2019-10-14 10:41:01,067 DEBUG [XXXXXX] Caesium-1-4 anonymous  XXXXX Cannot find reporter for message. Creating new user.
2019-10-14 10:41:01,067 ERROR [XXXXXX] Caesium-1-4 anonymous  XXXXX[10100]: There are no default applications configured, new users are not assigned to any groups therefore they can not create issues. Please visit Application Access page for more information.
{code}

The behavior is intended by default, since the Jira Core Mail Handler is not designed to be used with a Service Desk project, as it expects users to have application access to create emails (but Service Desk customers are by design users without application access).

Due to the fact that the Jira Core Mail Handler contains more configuration and features than the Service Desk Mail Handler (configured in *Project Settings > Email Requests*), some customers prefer to use the Jira Core Mail Handler rather than the Service Desk Mail Handler.

h3. Suggestion

Add some configuration to the Jira Core Mail Handler to allow the creation of customer-type users (users without application access), when it's configured with a Service Desk project and when no default application access is configured.
fields.summary: Add an option to the Jira Core Mail Handler to create new users without using a license, when linked to a Service Desk project

fields.description:
{panel:title=Solution|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This problem is caused by a bug in the Java runtime: _JDK-8214418 HttpClient falls in running with 100% cpu usage after an error signalled on channel_ (Backported as [JDK-8241054|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8241054])

The fix has been verified to be available in AdoptOpenJDK 11.0.8 - [https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk11u/commit/8d1b63a4db2c6348a97b3cf45bd4d2caa7cad6b5]
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

High CPU usage is noticed on I/O Dispatcher threads.
 Jira is up on Java 11.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

No particular steps to reproduce, issue happens randomly even when Jira is not under load.
h3. Expected Results

I/O Dispatcher threads shouldn't be using lots of CPU.
h3. Actual Results

At least One I/O Dispatcher thread is using up 99% CPU.
 You can see from the below Thread dump snapshot that the I/O Dispatcher is stuck in runnable and is using a lot of CPU time:
{noformat}
"I/O dispatcher 12" #94 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 cpu=3439222.56ms elapsed=5220.64s tid=0x0000ff0e98033000 nid=0x3cf5 runnable  [0x0000ff0e98033000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.wrap(java.base@11.0.4/SSLEngineImpl.java:136)
        - locked <0x00000006dfc4cb18> (a sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl)
        at sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.wrap(java.base@11.0.4/SSLEngineImpl.java:116)
        - locked <0x00000006dfc4cb18> (a sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl)
        at javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine.wrap(java.base@11.0.4/SSLEngine.java:479)
        at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.doWrap(SSLIOSession.java:263)
        at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.doHandshake(SSLIOSession.java:301)
        at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.isAppInputReady(SSLIOSession.java:503)
        - locked <0x00000006dfc4c5a8> (a org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIODispatch.inputReady(AbstractIODispatch.java:120)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.BaseIOReactor.readable(BaseIOReactor.java:162)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.processEvent(AbstractIOReactor.java:337)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.processEvents(AbstractIOReactor.java:315)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.execute(AbstractIOReactor.java:276)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.BaseIOReactor.execute(BaseIOReactor.java:104)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor$Worker.run(AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor.java:588)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(java.base@11.0.4/Thread.java:834)

   Locked ownable synchronizers:
        - None
{noformat}
The CPU data also shows the same thread is using more than 90% of CPU:
{noformat}
  PID USER      PR  NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND                                                     
15605 tcjira    20   0 11.8g 5.2g  68m R 99.2 44.5  58:02.42 I/O dispatcher                                              
15321 tcjira    20   0 11.8g 5.2g  68m S  1.9 44.5   0:06.70 VM Periodic Tas   
{noformat}
h3. Note:
 * The problem is related to a bug in the httpcore library that ships with Apache Httpclient used by Jira to communicate with remote services: [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCORE-583].
 * The bug in httpcore was fixed in *4.4.12*.
 * The bug is triggered when Java 11 is used in combination with a version of httpcore that has the problem.
 * Jira ships with multiple versions of the httpcore library, main Jira 8.4.2 uses *httpcore-4.4.9.jar*, while some other bundled plugins use other versions:
 ** jira-workflow-sharing-plugin-2.2.3.jar-embedded uses httpcore-4.4.1.jar
 ** atlassian-remote-event-common-plugin-6.1.0.jar-embedded uses httpcore-4.4.10.jar

h3. Solution

Upgrade AdoptOpenJDK to version 11.0.8 which has this issue solved.
h3. Workaround

 * Downgrade your JDK version from jdk 11 to jdk 1.8, Java 1.8 is not known to cause this problem.
 * The issue is observed with Java 11 that uses TLS v1.3. TLS v1.2 is unaffected by this. It's possible to force Java 11 to use TLS v1.2 by adding the following JVM parameter: {{-Dhttps.protocols=TLSv1.2}} to your startup properties.
fields.summary: High CPU usage from IO Dispatcher threads when using Java 11

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While Archiving issues is a useful feature in Data Center instances. Having a means of deletion after a certain time would be a nice function to have. 

h3. Suggested Solution
For example, in a specific use case, we have a retention period of 18 months, and anything after 12 months can be archived. Being able to auto-delete these archived issues after 18 months would be really nice.

h3. Workaround 
Create a script similar to one mentioned in [Is there an easy way to archive a lot of issues?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/is-there-an-easy-way-to-archive-a-lot-of-issues-976766896.html]
fields.summary: Ability to auto-delete Archived issues

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira Data Center, we have the ability to archive Issues.
In the most recent versions, we are only able to archive the sub-task if we archive the parent issue.

In some use cases, it would be useful to archive the sub-task alone and keep the parent issue.
fields.summary: Ability to Archive Sub-task issues alone

{code}
2019-10-18 11:00:53,239 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [c.a.upgrade.core.DefaultUpgradeTaskFactoryProcessor] Upgrade task [host,buildNumber=710001] failed
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error running original upgrade task

Caused by: com.querydsl.core.NonUniqueResultException: Only one result is allowed for fetchOne calls
        at com.querydsl.core.support.FetchableQueryBase.uniqueResult(FetchableQueryBase.java:64)
        at com.querydsl.sql.ProjectableSQLQuery.fetchOne(ProjectableSQLQuery.java:398)

        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build710001.getStringProperty(UpgradeTask_Build710001.java:102)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build710001.isDefault(UpgradeTask_Build710001.java:88)
        at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:174)
        at com.google.common.collect.CollectSpliterators$1WithCharacteristics.lambda$forEachRemaining$1(CollectSpliterators.java:64)
        at java.util.stream.Streams$RangeIntSpliterator.forEachRemaining(Streams.java:110)
        at com.google.common.collect.CollectSpliterators$1WithCharacteristics.forEachRemaining(CollectSpliterators.java:64)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
        at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build710001.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask_Build710001.java:66)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeTask.runUpgrade(AbstractUpgradeTask.java:62)
        ... 45 more
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Stop Jira 
# Take a database backup
# Execute the query below to find any properties that are duplicated. (note this is written against psql and may need to be modified for other database engines)
{code}
SELECT property_key,
       count(*)
FROM public.propertystring O_S_PROPERTY_STRING
JOIN public.propertyentry O_S_PROPERTY_ENTRY ON O_S_PROPERTY_ENTRY.id = O_S_PROPERTY_STRING.id
WHERE O_S_PROPERTY_ENTRY.property_key like 'jira.lf.%'
GROUP BY property_key HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
{code}
# If the above query shows any results we will need to delete the duplicated value in both the {{propertystring}} and {{propertyentry}} tables. We can take the {{property_key}} value returned from the query above and construct the following query to find the id for both values:
{code}
SELECT *
FROM public.propertystring O_S_PROPERTY_STRING
JOIN public.propertyentry O_S_PROPERTY_ENTRY ON O_S_PROPERTY_ENTRY.id = O_S_PROPERTY_STRING.id
WHERE O_S_PROPERTY_ENTRY.property_key = 'property_key from above';
{code}
# Now we just need to delete one of the returned records from both tables. To do this we can simply construct a delete statement by id for both tables. Let's say we have the following output:
||id || propertyvalue || id || entity_name || entity_id|| property_key || propertytype||
| 11128327 | #87b9d2 | 11128327 | jira.properties | 1 |jira.lf.gadget.color5 |5|
| 11128328 | #87b9d2 | 11128328 | jira.properties | 1 | jira.lf.gadget.color5 | 5|
# If we pick the higher id value the 2 queries would be the following:
{code}
delete from propertyentry where id = 11128328;
delete from propertystring where id = 11128328;
{code}
# Let's now run the query in step 3 again and if there's no results we can start up Jira and verify the error is not occuring anymore.
fields.summary: UpgradeTask_Build710001 fails due to duplicate property_key entry in database.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira 8.5 was released on Wed 22 Oct 2019 but MAC is not aware of the 8.5 release. Apps still showing Jira  8.4.x as the latest compatible version, see below. 

!sr.png|thumbnail!

This will mark existing Apps as Incompatible in the UPM. 

h3. Environment

Jira 8.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade Jira to 8.5 ER
 # Navigate to Administration > Manage Add-ons page 

h3. Expected Results

Apps have option to update to 8.5 version

h3. Actual Results

Apps have no option to update to 8.5 version

h3. Workaround
Apps that are compatible with Jira 8.4.2 will work with 8.5.0.  As a workaround, we can use UPM's file upload method to upgrade/install the app versions that are compatible with 8.4.2 into Jira 8.5.0:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/installing-add-ons-273875715.html#InstallingMarketplaceapps-Installingbyfileupload

h3. Note
This is being actively fixed with marketplace.atlassian.com, as the problem is not in the Jira product.
fields.summary: Apps on marketplace.atlassian.com not updated to be compatible with Jira 8.5 release

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If reindexing is disabled for upgrades ({{upgrade.reindex.allowed=false}}), a pending reindex request stays in the database, leading to a persistent "reindexing needed" message. Removing this property will make Jira run a full reindex on the next restart.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable automatic reindexing after an upgrade per: [How To Disable Automatic Re-indexes After Upgrading|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-disable-automatic-re-indexes-after-upgrading-935383670.html] by setting {{upgrade.reindex.allowed=false}} in {{jira-config.properties}}
 # Upgrade
 # Do not remove the property
 # Start Jira and log in to see the message: "While upgrading Jira an upgrade task made changes that require reindexing."
 # Run foreground (locking) reindex manually
 # Observe the message is still appearing
 # Click 'x' and see the message is gone
 # Restart Jira and see the message re-appears
 # Remove the {{upgrade.reindex.allowed=false}} property
 # Restart Jira
 # (x) A full foreground (locking) reindex is triggered, just as if Jira had just been upgraded

h3. Expected Results

Full lock and reindex would satisfy the system and stop messaging. 
 More importantly, once the full reindex is run, another one must not be triggered.
h3. Actual Results

Messaging continues to appear after full lock and reindex while the variable is still enabled.
 Full re-index is triggered once the variable is disabled.
h3. *Recommendation*

Keep the variable set until you upgrade to 8.5.2.
h3. Workaround #1

Remove variable and restart Jira. Wait for Jira to perform full re-index.
h3. Workaround #2

Stop Jira.
 Remove the pending reindex request by updating the DB:
{code:sql}
delete from REINDEX_REQUEST 
where status='PENDING'{code}
Start Jira.
fields.summary: upgrade.reindex.allowed=false leaves a pending reindex request after 7.x->8.x upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73240].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Office 365 is planning to discontinue support for basic auth on services like POP and IMAP on October 13, 2020.  As of today, basic auth (username and password) via IMAP/POP is the only way to make Jira able to use an Office 365 mailbox for receiving email.  More details about the upcoming changes to Microsoft's products can be found in https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/office/blogs/end-of-support-for-basic-authentication-access-to-exchange-online-apis-for-office-365-customers/

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement some other method of allowing Jira to authenticate to an office 365 mailbox, such as OAuth2.

h3. Why this is important
Without this feature, regular office 365 accounts won't permit applications like Jira to connect to them.  It seems that the ProPlus accounts might still permit this after the set date, however it seems clear that improving security is the goal of this forced change, and perhaps it would benefit Jira to follow suit.


h3. Workaround 
None currently, if one should become available this will be updated to reflect that state.
fields.summary: Add support for Office 365 Modern Authentication in Jira

fields.description:
*Issue:* Implementation of a Jira DC cluster requires a load balancer to store a persistence record of a users session so requests with the users session ID are routed to the specific Jira DC node where that session is present. In turn, an administrator is obliged to maintain this configuration on the load balancer as part of their Jira DC implementation. This is undesirable as it has both an implementation and operational overhead in addition to users being logged out if a node fails or is taken offline for maintenance.

*Goal:* Session ID's are shared between Jira DC nodes eliminating the need for persistence records on a load balancer and in turn allow any http request to be served from any Jira DC node.

*Benefits:*

Reduction of Jira DC implementation complexity.

Jira DC nodes can fail or be disabled without users loosing their sessions.

Enhanced HA.
fields.summary: Manage sessions within Jira DC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The horizontal scroll bar is only displayed at the bottom of the screen on the issue navigator
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Jira Software Issue list view panel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Issue Navigator
 # Run a JQL Query to display a list of issues
 # Select "List view" and observe the difference in the scroll bar.

h3. Expected Results

The scroll bar is displayed as a locked tab, so users don't need to navigate to the bottom of the screen to see the scroll bar as in Jira 7.13.x
h3. Actual Results

Users need to navigate to the bottom of the screen to see a horizontal scroll bar and navigate to the remaining columns.
 !8.PNG|thumbnail!
  
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Horizontal scrolling is available by using:
 * Touchpad
 * Shift + mouse scroll
 * Keyboard arrows
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bar is only displayed at the bottom of the screen on issue navigator

fields.description:
*Problem:* Changes made to Service Desk automation are not included in the audit logs. 

*Suggested Fix*: Add changes made to automation in the Service Desk logs
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to see changes made to Automations in the Audit Log

fields.description: One major piece of functionality that is missing for our teams using Portfolio is that when the end date of a parent ticket gets extended the start dates for dependent tickets don't auto-adjust accordingly. We need the option to have the dates on these dependencies also update.
fields.summary: Update start and end dates of dependencies when changing parent dates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Without clicking (Show X more links) button. The maximum value of the visible "Issue Links" in an issue is "5" which is too little for some customers.
Where X= the number of the hidden "Issue Links".

The picture below demonstrates the problem. only 5 links out of 9 links are visible

 !links.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Increasing the maximum value of the visible "Issue Links" for an issue without needing to click the (Show X more links) button.
Where X= the number of the hidden "Issue Links" 

The picture below shows what it should look like. All 9 links are visible without clicking (Show 4 more links) button

 !all links.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Click (Show X more links) button to show more "Issue Links" in an issue.
Where X= the number of the hidden "Issue Links".

The picture below shows all 9 links after clicking (Show 4 more links) button.

 !all links.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Increase the number of the visible "Issue Links" for an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 

In a clean browser with no cookies I can browse to:

[https://myhost/includes/jira/admin/group-browser]

Our security team says that 404 error messages give the impression that there is a directory there, vs a 200 is an authentication error.
h3. Explanation

There are numerous risks associated with presence of directories with easy-to-guess names and locations. Through enumeration, attackers can fingerprint platforms and applications that are known to use specific directory names.

These directories can also lead to exposure of sensitive information and privileged functionality. Predictable directory names and locations could expose admin interfaces, log files, configuration files, source code files and allow an attacker to add, remove or modify files.

Reconnaissance is a fundamental requirement for a successful attack. Predictable directory names and locations can make it very easy to map their target and obtain information essential for compromising the target.
fields.summary: The following link results in 404 instead of 200. https://myhost/includes/jira/admin/group-browser
Using REST API to create issues it is possible to use archived Fix Versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira loads large CSS and Javascript files on every page load, and it does look like some of this heavy lifting is avoidable. The size of these .js and .css files does cause inefficient client-side performance, especially when there is some network latency or on low resource client machines. After static content has been cached load times will improve significantly, but that initial experience for users who often re-login after browser cache has expired can be quite bad. The implications of this inefficiency with heavy static content handling is a lot worse on certain browser e.g. IE than others.
* Agencies with old client machines tend to deal with the inefficient client-side performance more frequently.

Chrome's Google Lighthouse scores for a vanilla instance are lower than 20 as illustrated in screenshots below. A quick test can be done with a public JAC URL:
-  http://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=

 !jira.atlassian.com.png|thumbnail!  !little to no plugin vanilla jira 8.1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
To look into reducing the size and amount of Javascript, CSS and other static content that JIRA requests on every page and avoid requesting huge static files when it can be avoided.
fields.summary: JIRA to handle its JS and CSS more efficiently

fields.summary: JIRA > Comments > History > identifying description updates

fields.description:
When cloning an issue and it's sub-tasks all of them get a prefix of "CLONE-{issueName}
".

The issue at hand is that the jira.clone.prefix system property cannot be set individually per project.

What we would like to request to set a way to set this property individually for each project so that some projects in the same instance adds a "CLONE -" prefix when cloning issues while other projects clones without the prefix / a different prefix for the name.
fields.summary: Specifying Cloned issue name prefix on a project level instead of a system wide setting

fields.description:
currently max number of clauses under Smart filter/Rich filter is set to 15.  

Issue is "Enter a valid number between 2 and 15"

We'd like to go beyond 15 - to 30

*Request is therefore "Raise maximum range for smart filter clauses to 30"*

!image-2019-09-18-15-36-51-786.png!
fields.summary: Increase number of clauses for Smart filter under Rich filter

fields.description:
Currently [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/creating-a-test-environment-for-jira-966063324.html] about setting up staging environment for Jira Data Center contains no information about removing Production nodes from the {{clusternode}} table. 

This causes the Staging environment to try and communicate with production. If clusters can see each other within network, that will cause issues (i.e. indexing in one cluster will trigger reindexing on the other).
fields.summary: Include extra step in DC Staging documentation to remove production nodes from clusternode table

fields.description:
This was one of those differences between Confluence and Jira that endlessly stands out to me for its inconsistency. In Confluence, the 'Manage apps' link in the menu bar goes to the manage apps page, while in Jira it goes to the 'Find new apps' page. The link itself in the menu bar has an identifier inconsistent with its user-facing name: ?source=side_nav_find_new_addons

This looks especially wonky if one hits 'gg' and types out 'manage apps' in Jira.

I'd suggest that the shortcut either be named 'Manage apps' and take users to the page of the same name, or the shortcut be renamed 'Find new apps' or a more generalized 'Apps' to avoid the confusion altogether.
fields.summary: Manage apps link should go to Manage apps page
Renaming users multiple times should display their username instead of user_key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Wiki Toolbar is disabled when editing a content with \{noformat\} notation in Visual mode. \{noformat\} is one of the [accepted notations in Wiki Renderer|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In any text field with Wiki Renderer, add any content with \{noformat\} notation in Text mode.
# Switch the mode from Text to Visual to preview the content.
# Save the text field from Visual Mode.
# Edit the text field.

h3. Expected Results
Wiki Toolbar is active and can be used.

h3. Actual Results
Wiki Toolbar is disabled when editing in Visual mode - this happens if we first click Edit and and we're taken to Visual mode:
 !noformat-visual-mode.jpg|thumbnail! 

In Text mode it's fine:
 !noformat-text-mode.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Switch the mode from Visual to Text, and then back to Visual again.
fields.summary: Wiki Toolbar is disabled when editing a content with {noformat} notation in Visual mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Plan your Upgrade* tool is not updating the latest versions available. Therefore, users are not able to use it.

h3. Environment

 * Jira Server running versions below 8.4.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Go to Cog > Applications > Plan your upgrade

h3. Expected Results

Jira will show all available upgrades to your system

h3. Actual Results

Jira is not showing the latest versions available

The system is trying to reach the URL {{puds.prod.atl-paas.net}} but this URL resolves to a local IP address inside a private IP range CIDR (10.0.0.0/8), therefore it won't work for networks outside of Atlassian's own.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Plan your Upgrade tool not working because of a private IP in PUDS URL

 * Portfolio 3.12.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Unpack JDK and configure JAVA_HOME and PATH
 # Configure and start Jira as a service (from zip distribution)

h3. Expected Results
 * Jira starts

h3. Actual Results
* Error page
The below exception is thrown in the attlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
.2019-10-17 03:06:55,529 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] Running JIRA startup checks.
2019-10-17 03:06:55,529 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] JIRA pre-database startup checks completed successfully.
2019-10-17 03:06:55,576 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] Unable to start JIRA.
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: C:\Java\adopt\jdk-11.0.4+11\bin\awt.dll: Can't find dependent libraries
	at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load0(Native Method)
	at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(ClassLoader.java:2430)

	at java.desktop/java.awt.Toolkit$3.run(Toolkit.java:1395)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.Toolkit$3.run(Toolkit.java:1393)
	at java.base/java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.Toolkit.loadLibraries(Toolkit.java:1392)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.Toolkit.<clinit>(Toolkit.java:1425)
	at java.desktop/sun.awt.AppContext$2.run(AppContext.java:282)
	at java.desktop/sun.awt.AppContext$2.run(AppContext.java:271)
	at java.base/java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.desktop/sun.awt.AppContext.initMainAppContext(AppContext.java:271)
	at java.desktop/sun.awt.AppContext$3.run(AppContext.java:326)
	at java.desktop/sun.awt.AppContext$3.run(AppContext.java:309)
	at java.base/java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.desktop/sun.awt.AppContext.getAppContext(AppContext.java:308)
	at java.desktop/javax.imageio.spi.IIORegistry.getDefaultInstance(IIORegistry.java:129)
	at java.desktop/javax.imageio.ImageIO.<clinit>(ImageIO.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.ImageIOProviderScannerLauncher.start(ImageIOProviderScannerLauncher.java:14)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.preDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:120)

h3. Workaround
There are two workarounds for this issue. One is to use AdoptOpenJDK 11.0.1_13 which doesn't have this issue.

The other one requires some additional work:
1. Stop Jira service
2. Change the permissions for JVM dir (and subdirs), add 'Local Account' (make sure it's added to all files and subdirectories)
3. Modify jira_install_dir/bin/serivce.bat (at the end of the script)
Change

    --StartMode jvm ^
    --StopMode jvm ^
into

    --StartMode java ^
    --StopMode java ^
4. Reinstall the service (in the jira_install_dir/bin directory run `service remove` and `service install`
5. Run Jira service again

On the Kanban and Scrum Boards we have the possibility to configure swimlanes, which is already great.

However, we use that quite often to move recurring tasks into separate swimlanes and then end up with having all the recurring tasks on the top swimlanes but the actual work ends up in "Everything Else" which is always at the bottom.

fields.description:
Hi,

 

something really bugging me out, is there a reason why the IDs of the customfieldoption is stored in the "Stringvalue" Column of the customfieldvalue Table instead of the more appropriate "Numbervalue" Column ?

 

Not only is this highly misleading, i don't see any reason for this as even for multiselectboxes this Information is stored in seperate data sets. And for all the datasets where this reference is linked, the numbervalue is always NULL.

 

This not only leads to massive performance problems when transfering the Data to a DWH, I suspect it is also a massive performance loss for the Application itself because of matching string values with numbervalues all the time (join nvarchar with decimal). For every issue which includes a Customfield with predefined options Jira has to cas the string to a number for every field.

And i dont see any reason for not fixing this , which would be relativly easy anyway.

 

Example:

SELECT *
 FROM customfieldvalue cfv
 inner join customfield cf on cfv.CUSTOMFIELD = cf.ID
 where cf.CUSTOMFIELDTYPEKEY like '%:multicheckboxes'
 _and cfv.NUMBERVALUE is not null_

!image-2019-10-16-09-20-52-899.png!
fields.summary: Storing the customfieldoption ID in customfieldvalue in Numbervalue instead of Stringvalue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Jira issue matches more than 4 successful deployments. The development field summary on the issue navigator would indicate that the issue is deployed to environments 1,2, 3 and x more... where 1,2,3 for example are different environments and x are as many more environments as are not explicitly listed in the issue navigator summary, but are collapsed. When searching for issues that match a deployment environment collapsed under the *... and x more* collapsed list using development[deployments].environment JQL, the issues are not matched.

h3. Environment
Jira 8.0.2+
 Any version of Bamboo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira with Bamboo
# Ensure there are Jira issues deployed successfully to more than 3 deployment environments as shown below for example:
 !deployment-summary.png|thumbnail! 
note that "taiwo environment 5" is the environment not explicitly mentioned, but is actually collapsed under *and 1 more* in screenshot above:
 !deployment-details.png|thumbnail! 
 # Execute JQL such as:
{code}
development[deployments].environment = "..."
{code}
Where "..." is any of the environment shown in the deployment details for an issue.

h3. Expected Results
For every environment used in that JQL for example, Jira should return the issue (DEMO-24 in this example).

h3. Actual Results
Jira only returns DEMO-24 for the environments specifically named in the development field summary on issue navigator
 !deployment-summary.png|thumbnail! 
 !deployment-match.png|thumbnail! 
environments that are collapsed under *and 'x' more* (in this example "taiwo environment 5" )are not matched by {{development[deployments].environment =}} 
or
{{development[deployments].environment in}}
 !deployment-not-matched.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently no workaround

h3. Notes
 * Issue is neither caused by stale indexes nor resolved by re-indexing. Note that both the issue navigator's development field summary and detail shows the collapsed environments, however the JQL only returns the ones explicitly named in the summary and doesn't match the collapsed environments.
 * issue.property[development].environment is broken in similar manner
fields.summary: development[deployments].environment JQL function doesn't return all matched environments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Share Issue > Note formatting is lost when ‘Email Type’ preferences is set to "HTML".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to User Profile > Click on edit icon in Preferences section > Select “Email Type” as HTML > Click Update.
 # Now from Issue page, click on the share icon, enter the user email and in the Note field, enter some text having newline.
 !image-2019-10-15-16-06-33-530.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click 'Share'.
 # The email received by the user is not formatted correctly:
 !image-2019-10-15-16-04-48-105.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The note text in the email should be in the format the same as shared originally in the note on the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The note text in the email is not formatted correctly and all the new lines are skipped.

h3. Notes
The users only receive Notes field in the proper format if they meet the following pre-requisite 
* The user with whom the Jira issue is shared has set their “Email Type” Preferences to 'Text'.
* If the issue is shared with External Users, who are not Jira users, then they will receive "Notes" in improper format as they cannot update their "Email Type" preferences.
* Able to replicate this issue on Jira version 7.90, 7.13.0, 8.2.2,

h3. Workaround
If sharing the issue with Jira users, you can ask the user to change the “Email Type” Preferences to Text. No workaround is possible for external users at the moment.
fields.summary: Share Issue > Note formatting is lost when ‘Email Type’ preferences is set to "HTML".

fields.description:
Historically Jira supported wildcarded group names in group filters for groups to sync for synched ldap directories but not for delegated ldap directories.

Further detail: With Delegated we can specify what groups get imported into the local directory when the user logs in by means of the group filter.  But wildcards don't get respected for that filter, with the delegated directories,  names have to be fully enumerated. 

With Connector LDAP, Synced the group filter can contain wildcard and we use that feature today. But we want to switch to delegated and lack of wildcards there is a showstopper for the customer.

The docs never really reflected the problem that LDAP connector (Synched type) supported wildcards and Delegated didn't.
fields.summary: Support for wildcarded group names in group filters when syncing with Delegated LDAP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you open saved filter and edit it you must execute a search before you can save, this is working as intended.  However there is an error occuring on the method used to trigger the search and there a difference in outcome when you trigger the search via the enter/return key or if you click the "Search" button with your mouse before you save, Noting this is a cosmetic error only but does cause confusion as to wether the save was successful not leaving behind a "Edited" identifier intended to tell the user the filter needs to be saved although it already has been saved.

h3. Environment
Jira Server verified on multiple 7.x and 8.x versions
For Jira Cloud See corresponding BUG: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73145

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Saved filter in the issue navigator
# edit the filter in any way
# Note that next to the JQL's title a object "Edited" appears noting a change occurred to the filter and it needs to be saved
# Click the search button with your mouse
# Click Save
# a popup noting the save was successful will appear in the upper right corner of the active browser window
# Note the "Edited" notation goes away 
# Note that the filter is saved correctly
# Make another change to the filter
# Note the "Edited" notation re-appears
# This time Hit return/enter key to trigger the search
# Select save
# a popup noting the save was successful will appear in the upper right corner of the active browser window

h3. Expected Results
It is expected that the Edited notation will go away noting the current filter displayed is correct without any pending edits needed to be saved before navigating from the page

h3. Actual Results
While the filter is correctly saved it will still display the "Edited" object causing confusion to the end user that is not sure if the filter has actually saved correctly or not
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-14 at 10.59.02 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
The "Edited" notation is class "filter-edited-object"

h3. Workaround
Using the mouse click to search before saving will make the edited notation go away to provide verification the filter was saved, BUT it is not necessarily needed as the save action is completing and and a popup will note successful as well so the edited notation is only a cosmetic error,  But just to be on the save side you can also re-open the filter in a new tab just to verify the save was successful so you do not navigate away and loose track of the filter changes.
fields.summary: Mouse Click and return/enter in JQL edit have different outcomes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Upgrading Jira from 7.X to 8.4.2 causes tables and columns to not be created.
h3. Environment

Jira 7.12.3 | Windows Server | MySQL 5.6
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade Jira data from 7.12.3 to Jira 8.4.2 running an *in place* upgrade.

h3. Expected Results

The upgrade concludes gracefully
h3. Actual Results

All indexed entities fail to be displayed and Jira is unusable as a result.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.get] "archived" is not a field of Issue
com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.get] "archived" is not a field of Component
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Option 1) Step into 8.4.1 first then upgrade to 8.4.2

Option 2) So far, the issue has been reported to only occur while upgrading using the installer. On the other hand, upgrading manually is considered to be free of this bug and is the recommended way for 7.x - > 8.4.x/8.5.x path as detailed in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/upgrading-from-jira-7-x-to-jira-8-5-results-in-data-base-tables-and-columns-missing-978222133.html]
fields.summary: Upgrading Jira from 7.X to 8.4.2 causes tables and columns to not be created.

h3. Summary
Within a Comment or Description type field, adding an attachment link in the comment, and creating a bullet list or numbered list will sometimes incorrectly superscript the text that follows

h3. Environment
* Replicated in Jira 8.4.1 with Chrome 77.0.3865.90


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a file to a Jira issue
# Create a new comment on that issue, be sure to use the visual text editor in the comment
# Using the paperclip icon in the text editor, add a link to that uploaded attachment
# Then click either the bullet list OR numbered list
# Move the cursor to the end of the line (either via mouse click or keyboard arrow keys)
# Press Enter/Return to get a new line in the list
# Enter some additional text

h3. Expected Results
The entered text should appear normally.

h3. Actual Results
The entered text instead is superscripted
 
h3. Notes
Switching over to Text editor mode we can see that the caret symbol appears ot be getting added to the text on that line, and subsequent lines.

h3.Workaround
Using the Text editor mode instead of Visual editor mode is one way to work past this bug.

h4. Problem definition
The "Link issue" functionality has a "search for an issue" link that allows the creation of a JQL search. The maximum number of values returned, however, is 10. This is because the request includes a "{{maxResults}}" parameter which is hardcoded directly into the file ({{jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-issue-link-remote-jira-plugin/src/main/resources/js/issuelink-jira-search.js}}).

h4. Suggested solution
Add a widget to the page to allow clients to configure the number of returned results with the same JQL query.
fields.summary: Make number of results configurable in "link issue" JQL search

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition

The method to disable auto-export as in [Disabling auto-export|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/disabling-auto-export-828787648.html] is to modify the {{jira.config.properties}} file and setting the property {{jira.autoexport=false}}.
h4. Suggested solution

Add an on/off option in the General configuration section of the Jira Administration System settings. This would also minimise potential to corrupt the configuration file.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? See the [corresponding bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73153].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

In Brazil, we won't have daylight saving in 2019 and it may impact our products.

On October 20, our timezone in Brazil would change to GMT -2, but in 2019 it won't happen, so the timezone in Jira and Confluence may change and affect Due Dates, SLAs, Team calendar among other things.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Any field tied to a timezone change will be affected.

It may also affect SLA for Service Desk issues.
h3. Expected Results

On October 20, it should keep GMT -3 for Sao Paulo's timezone.
h3. Actual Results

It will show the wrong information because the timezone will be GMT -2. 
h3. Workaround

Change the timezone manually to GMT -3 using another country's timezone, like Argentina (Buenos Aires).
fields.summary: Brazil's daylight saving

fields.description:
I would like to execute the following query in JQL:

project in (<Project>) AND issuetype in (<Issue types>) *AND status changed FROM testing TO Closed BEFORE {color:#ff8b00}_due_{color}*

Where due can be a custom date field.

Is there a chance to do this without any extra plugin and just using pure JQL? Or maybe my query is incorrect?

 

currently I have the following error:
!image-2019-10-10-10-21-06-675.png!

{color:#FF0000}Date value 'due' for predicate 'before' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm', 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm', 'yyyy/MM/dd', 'yyyy-MM-dd', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d'.{color}

The format of my due field is like 'yyyy-MM-dd'

 

My current version of Jira is 6.4.9 but I can updated if it is required.

 

Thank you in advance for your attention.
fields.summary: Add ability to use due date of custom date field as a valid predicate
